intro: Phytolacca dodecandra var. brevipedicellata, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed Indian mallow, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into fleshy, red berries. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Botanically, it belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus.
